intro: Primula curviflora, commonly known as the curling flower primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with oval, dark green leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
